About Me

Let me tell you a few things...

BIO

I am a videographer, editor, and web developer looking to expand my skills and work on new and different projects.

Rutgers University

Videographer and Editor

Working for Rutgers University Sports Department, I was in charge of producing video segments to be shown online and in-person so as to represent the University and department. I worked often as part of a small team that I was in charge of, and was tasked with covering all steps of production from idea synthesis and pre-production through filming and eventually post-production. I handled post-production work on my own, but worked as a team in many different roles especially while filming. This proved to be a great work experience as I developed a diverse set of skills so that I feel comfortable in many aspects of film production, while still carving out a niche for myself in post-production work.

New Jersey International Film Festival

Film Intern

I served as the second level of judgement for submitted films into the New Jersey International Film Festival. As interns we viewed the submitted feature films and shorts, that come from all over the world in all languages, and produced a written rating and review to argue either for or against the film's merit as per gaining entrance into the festival. I also assisted in various duties and helped run the film festival screenings themselves, including meeting and managing filmmakers and actors. The internship put an emphasis on our abilities as film scholars as well as our taste and vision in our field.

Appen Global & Instagram

Social Media Assessor

In charge of managing and reviewing advertisements as to how effective their engagement was with social media users.
